page.title: 13HOUSING IN CENTRAL SOUTHEND
page.content: {General}:This inner city area has a high housing density built 1890-1910. Mostly terraced houses of brick and slate on a grid iron plan.On street parking.Average house price Â£33,000. {Amenities}:Mixed with houses are churches (6 in this sample sq),corner shops,schools and small works.These amenities are in decline,2 churches empty,the infants school (Hamlet Ct.) closed,the secondary school is planned to close (Westborough Girls).On a transect of 3 streets there were 10 closed corner shops,2 empty rest con- verted.Central shops in CBD have killed them off except along A13. {Redevelopment}:Two major clearances North Rd (now high rise flats) and Boston Avenue (now mid-rise pensioner homes).North Rd site has the only open recreational space in the square.
